sub_subject.name: Nature Study (Charlotte Mason Observation & Wonder)
sub_subject.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Nature Study (Charlotte Mason Observation & Wonder) (Science & Nature)

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Name 5–10 common local wildflowers, trees, or birds.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Identify recurring natural rhythms in the local environment.
Name three things seen or heard during quiet time.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Name the current season and one visible sign.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Identify common animal signs (tracks, scat, bark rubbings).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Observe simple connections (bird eats worm, worm eats leaf).
Identify one local invasive species.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: List several signs of each season in the local area.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Observe a small ecosystem (pond, log, meadow).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Match real specimens to pictures in a simple guide.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Use simple picture keys to identify common species.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Draw a simple sun → plant → animal chain.
Copy simple labels with help.
Record with tallies or simple drawings.
Use ruler, thermometer, and simple timers accurately.
Graph simple data (bar graph of petal counts).
End each entry with simple thanks.
Craft hypotheses and design simple field tests.
Pray simple prayers of thanks for earth.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Praise God by name for each creature observed.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Press or trace a leaf ethically.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Learn 20–30 local species by sight and sound.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Explain how naming reflects Adam’s calling and God’s order.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Begin a pressed-plant or feather collection (ethical sources).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Use dichotomous keys accurately and independently.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Master 100+ local species across multiple taxa.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Lead identification walks for younger children.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Master regional flora and fauna using technical keys.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Contribute observations to citizen-science platforms with theological reflection.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Identifying Plants, Trees, Insects, Birds (using field guides and keys)
objectives.objective_text: Defend taxonomy as a reflection of the Creator’s mind.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Point out colors, shapes, and movements in creation.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Notice something new on every nature walk.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Say ‘God made this beautiful!’

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Draw one detailed leaf, feather, or insect.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Notice tiny details such as veins in leaves or segments on insects.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Keep a weekly record of one changing thing (tree, pond, sky).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Explain how details reveal God’s care (Matt 6:28–29).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Begin a dedicated nature journal with careful drawings.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Record precise details in field sketches with measurements and notes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Track seasonal changes systematically (first bloom, leaf fall).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Produce museum-quality observational records.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Learning to See (noticing details and patterns, phenology)
objectives.objective_text: Defend attention to creation as loving the Creator (Rom 1:20).
Sit quietly outdoors and notice one thing God made without speaking.
Thank God for His beautiful world.
Draw or tell about the favorite thing observed.
Practice the habit of attention for 10–15 minutes outdoors.
Narrate orally in detail what was observed.
Record date, weather, and one wonder question.
Sustain focused observation for 20–30 minutes.
Distinguish between observation and interpretation.
Meditate on Psalm 46:10 (‘Be still and know that I am God’).
Begin a phenological wheel of the year.
Cultivate contemplative observation as spiritual discipline.
Defend nature observation as a means of grace and worship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Notice bare trees in winter or flowers in spring.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Thank God for changing seasons (Gen 8:22).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Draw the same tree or spot in different seasons.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Predict observable changes for the coming season.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Track temperature, daylight length, and phenological events.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Graph seasonal data collected over months.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Meditate on Ecclesiastes 3:1–8 and Acts 14:17.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Correlate folk weather wisdom with personal observations.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Maintain rigorous multi-year climate and phenology journals.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Seasonal Patterns (local climate variations, animal/plant behavior)
objectives.objective_text: Defend God’s wisdom in the design of seasonal cycles.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Look for tracks, nests, or birds without disturbing them.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Practice watching quietly and respectfully.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Thank God for the animals He made.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Draw animal signs found in mud or snow.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Practice ‘leave no trace’ and maintain ethical distance.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that dominion includes gentle care (Prov 12:10).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Begin a personal animal observation log.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Use field guides to identify species from signs and sightings.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Practice ethical wildlife photography and observation.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Conduct ethical wildlife surveys or non-invasive monitoring.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Tracking Local Wildlife (ethical distance, signs of animals)
objectives.objective_text: Defend biblical animal welfare against cruelty or indifference.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Know plants need sun and animals need plants.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Thank God for providing food for all creatures.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Explain ‘everything is connected’ in God’s world.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Sketch accurate food webs based on personal observation.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Meditate on Psalm 104’s interconnected praise.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Conduct a mini bio-blitz and record findings.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Understanding Ecosystems through Direct Observation (Food Webs, Interdependence)
objectives.objective_text: Defend interdependence as image of Triune God’s unity-in-diversity.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Add drawings or pressed items weekly to a special book.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Know the notebook is treasure because God made everything.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Look back and remember God’s kindness.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Keep pages neat as an offering.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Maintain a dedicated nature journal throughout the year.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Include pressed specimens when ethical.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Share entries in family worship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Curate a beautiful, organized notebook as lasting legacy.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Reflect yearly on growth in wonder and faith.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Mentor younger siblings in journaling.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Produce an heirloom-quality lifelong nature notebook.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Incorporate decades-long data where possible.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Defend lifelong attention as sustained worship.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Building a Long-Term Nature Notebook (A Record of Attention)
objectives.objective_text: Gift or publish selections for edification of Christ’s body.
Point to parts and name them (stem, petal, wing).
Draw arrows to important features.
Offer a prayer of thanks for each part.
Label main parts of flowers, insects, leaves, or birds.
Draw neat arrows and print labels clearly.
Include measurements when possible.
Ask one wonder question per entry.
Use proper scientific terminology consistently.
Include scale, date, location, and weather.
Produce professional annotated scientific plates.
Defend annotation as declaring God’s works (Ps 145:10).
Measure leaf or insect with hand spans or blocks.
Count petals, spots, or bird visits.
Say ‘God made it just right.’
Record data in prepared tables.
Note weather conditions each entry.
Record quantitative and qualitative data systematically.
Graph trends over weeks or months.
Maintain rigorous scientific data protocols over years.
Use spreadsheets and statistical tools appropriately.
Publish findings in local science fairs or journals.
Draw one object carefully, trying to make it look real.
Use colors and shapes noticed in creation.
Write or dictate ‘God made this.’
Date every page as worshipful record.
Draw with attention to shape, proportion, texture, and pattern.
Use watercolor or pencil skillfully.
Include magnified detail inset when possible.
Write a short narration beside the drawing.
Produce scientifically accurate illustrations suitable for publication.
Master shading, stippling, and scientific convention.
Include scale bar and precise labels.
Reflect theologically in captions or marginalia.
Defend beauty in scientific art as worship.
Compile a personal illustrated nature monograph.
Say or dictate one thing wondered about.
Copy a short psalm or hymn about creation.
Draw a smile if it made you happy in God.
Write 2–4 sentences of narration per entry.
Copy favorite nature poetry or Scripture.
Pose one thoughtful question per page.
Express awe in own words.
Write rich narrations and original nature poetry.
Form testable hypotheses from observations.
Quote and apply Scripture insightfully.
Reflect on how observation grows love for Christ.
Produce devotional-scientific reflections of publishable quality.
Weave theology and observation seamlessly.
Compile entries into a bound nature devotional for the church.
Install or use simple water-saving devices.
Calculate basic averages and ranges.
Recite ‘God made the world and told us to take care of it.’
Know Adam was to tend the garden and name animals.
Pick up trash as love for God’s creation.
Explain Genesis 1:28 and 2:15 in child-friendly words.
Distinguish dominion from destruction.
Practice cheerful garden or yard chores.
Memorize Psalm 24:1 (‘The earth is the Lord’s’).
Lead family creation-care initiatives.
Defend dominion as Christ-like servant rule.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Look but don’t pick flowers unless allowed.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Know bees and birds need plants too.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Thank God for beauty without taking.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Take pictures or draw instead.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Explain ‘take only pictures, leave only footprints.’

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Press flowers only from abundance or home garden.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Discuss why we don’t harm God’s creatures.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Research legal and ethical collecting guidelines.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Practice catch-and-release insect observation.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Write personal ethics statement.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Develop institutional-level ethics policy.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Collecting Nature Specimens (Respect for Life)
objectives.objective_text: Defend sanctity of life in ecosystems.
Plant a seed and care for it.
Pull weeds gently with permission.
Know God wants His garden to grow.
Draw before/after planting pictures.
Plant native flowers for bees and butterflies.
Explain why native plants are better.
Start a pollinator garden patch.
Remove invasives and plant natives responsibly.
Monitor restoration plot over seasons.
Teach others about habitat care.
Defend restoration as preview of new earth.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: See litter and say ‘this hurts God’s animals.’

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Know throwing trash on ground is wrong.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Help clean a park or yard.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Draw clean world vs. dirty world.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Explain how trash and pollution harm God’s creatures.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Sort recycling and reduce waste at home.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Write a prayer asking forgiveness and help.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Research one issue with biblical worldview.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Propose practical family solutions.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Human Impact on Ecosystems (Responsibility and Caution)
objectives.objective_text: Propose Christ-honoring policy and lifestyle responses.
Sort paper, plastic, glass into bins.
Know ‘reduce, reuse, recycle’ rhyme.
Thank God for materials He provides.
Make a craft from recycled items.
Explain why we recycle (stewardship, not waste).
Track family waste for one week.
Find three ways to reduce packaging.
Implement zero-waste challenges.
Teach recycling habits to others.
Defend frugality and simplicity as worship.
Turn off faucet while brushing teeth.
Know water is God’s precious gift.
Pray for children who walk far for water.
Draw the water cycle simply.
Measure water used in daily tasks.
Explain why we conserve (‘for others and God’s world’).
Learn about global water needs.
Track household water consumption quantitatively.
Research global water crisis with compassion.
Propose family conservation plan.
Defend clean water access as pro-life issue.
